aboutUsContent.foundation: Sera Terra was established in 2019 in Balıkesir. Following extensive research on medicinal and aromatic plants, cultivation activities commenced on approximately 15 decares of land. The agricultural activities began with rosemary and continued with lavender, thyme, white lily, and chamomile. Currently, over 70 decares are actively being used for cultivation, agriculture, and R&D activities.
aboutUsContent.investment: In 2022, investments began to produce value-added products from medicinal and aromatic plants. A facility with steam distillation and supercritical CO2 extraction lines was established, boasting a processing capacity of 250 tons. The facility became operational in August 2023.
aboutUsContent.support: The facility was supported through the IPARD program and built to meet EU standards and criteria. The product range includes essential and fixed oils for the aromatherapy and phytotherapy sectors, as well as plant extracts for the pharmaceutical and cosmetics industries.
aboutUsContent.researchCollaboration: R&D studies aimed at obtaining pure active ingredients are ongoing in collaboration with universities, the private sector, and TÜBİTAK.
aboutUsContent.mission: Our company has adopted the mission of delivering the miracles of the soil to humanity, focusing on producing value-added products and securing a consistent presence in the global market for food and cosmetic raw materials.

arge.researchContent: Our research and development activities are conducted by project teams adhering to scientific and ethical principles. These teams comprise researchers specialized in agriculture, chemistry, and pharmacology. At our R&D center, we meticulously carry out literature reviews, active ingredient evaluations, analyses of various plants and their applications, formulation design and development, and active ingredient purification. The primary goal of our R&D center is to produce quality and specific solutions for health, care, and beauty through innovative approaches and a passion for success within the healing world of plants. Currently, 10 different R&D projects are underway. In collaboration with TÜBİTAK, local Agricultural Directorates, universities, and three separate chemistry laboratories, we continue our efforts to derive value-added industrial products from plants.

kapsaisin.title: Obtaining Capsaicin
kapsaisin.content: Capsaicin is a chemical compound found in chili peppers that provides their heat and spiciness. It is present in the seeds, membranes, and fleshy parts of peppers. At our R&D center, the capsaicin purification process is conducted using the supercritical extraction method with the 'Carolina Reaper' pepper variety in collaboration with our laboratory partners and universities.

oleuropein.title: Obtaining Oleuropein
oleuropein.content: Oleuropein is a compound found in the leaves, fruits, and branches of the olive tree. It is one of the olive tree's natural defense mechanisms, protecting it from harmful organisms. Oleuropein is most commonly found in olive leaves and fruits. The steps to obtain oleuropein are as follows:
items: Collection of Olive Leaves: Olive leaves are collected, usually after the olive harvest.
Washing: The collected leaves are thoroughly washed and cleaned.
Grinding: The washed leaves are ground or chopped, facilitating better extraction of oleuropein.
Extraction: The ground leaves are extracted using the supercritical CO2 extraction method under low temperatures and high pressures.
Filtration: The olive leaf extract is filtered to separate the oleuropein-containing solution.
Purification: The solution containing oleuropein is purified and refined through various processes.
oleuropein.content2: Oleuropein is obtained through the extraction of olive leaves. These extracts are then used in health supplements, cosmetic products, or food additives.

juglone.title: Obtaining Juglone
juglone.content: Juglone is a chemical compound produced by walnut trees to outcompete other plants. It is found in high amounts in the green husks of walnuts. Some potential benefits and applications of juglone include:
items: Antimicrobial Properties: Juglone may have antimicrobial effects, inhibiting microbes and pathogens. This gives walnut trees a competitive advantage by limiting the growth of other plants around their roots.
Antioxidant Effects: Juglone possesses antioxidant properties that may help reduce cellular damage caused by free radicals.
Antiparasitic Properties: Juglone can act against certain parasitic organisms, providing natural protection through walnut leaves or husks.

linalol.title: Obtaining Linalool
linalol.content: Pure linalool is a volatile compound found in many plant sources, most notably in lavender. Industrial processes are used to isolate pure linalool as it is challenging to obtain in its pure form. The basic steps to obtain pure linalool are as follows:
items: Steam Distillation: The most common method for obtaining linalool involves steam distillation. Plant material is heated with steam, causing volatile oils to rise with the steam. The steam is then condensed, and the volatile oils are separated.
Chemical Isolation: Linalool is extracted from the volatile oils obtained and further isolated using fractional distillation, crystallization, or other chemical separation techniques.
Refinement: The extracted linalool is refined to remove impurities, enhancing its purity.
linalol.content2: Pure linalool is widely used in cosmetics, perfumes, cleaning products, and aromatherapy applications.

plant.companyInfo: Since 2019, our company has been cultivating lavender, thyme, rosemary, medicinal chamomile, and white lily on its own lands. These products are processed in our facility and marketed. In 2023, with the support of TKDK, our 'Medicinal and Aromatic Plant Processing Facility' became operational in Biga district. The main policy is to increase the cultivation of medicinal and aromatic plants in the Biga region and the Southern Marmara area. To this end, we continue to collaborate with Agricultural Provincial and District Directorates, Chambers of Agriculture, Çanakkale 18 Mart University, and chambers under TOBB. According to the World Health Organization, there are approximately 20,000 medicinal and aromatic plants used globally. Of these, 4,000 are widely used, and around 2,000 are traded worldwide. In our country, there are about 500 plants used medicinally, nearly all of which grow naturally. Only a small fraction has been cultivated. As a company, our goal is to promote the cultivation of value-added medicinal and aromatic plants in the Southern Marmara region.

step1.description: With the distillation line and supercritical extraction line in our facility, we produce raw materials and intermediates for the pharmaceutical and cosmetic industries. Our facility also produces final products in the fields of aromatherapy and phytotherapy.

step2.title: WHY DO WE AVOID NATURAL COLLECTION FOR MEDICINAL AND AROMATIC PLANTS?
reasons: Plants containing essential oils are harvested before seeding, preventing reproduction.
Overharvesting and careless collection pose risks of species decline or even extinction.
As these plants spread over large areas in nature, collection requires significant time and labor.
Random collection from nature does not ensure standardization and homogeneity.
Drying and storage processes for naturally collected plants often do not meet hygienic and quality standards.

step3.title: WHAT DO WE PAY ATTENTION TO IN OUR AGRICULTURAL STRATEGY AND CONTRACTUAL PRODUCTIONS?
factors: Market conditions for medicinal and aromatic plants
Determining the plant species and variety to be cultivated (with a preference for registered varieties)
The size of the area to be established for economic feasibility
The mechanization status of the farmer
Support for harvesting and post-harvest processes

process.description: Supercritical CO2 extraction is an industrial method used to obtain extracts from plants by employing high pressure and low temperature.
supercriticalPoints: The state of a pure substance above its critical temperature and pressure is known as the supercritical fluid state. Every pure substance has a critical temperature and pressure.

Supercritical fluids have several advantages over traditional solvents and the liquid-gas state of a pure substance. Their physicochemical properties (density, viscosity, diffusivity, dielectric constant, solubility parameter, etc.) change from gas-like to liquid-like characteristics by altering pressure and temperature.
A supercritical fluid efficiently uses both gas-phase and liquid properties, such as diffusion like a gas and high solvency like a liquid.
process.whyCO2: Why Do We Use CO2 in Extraction?
process.whyCO2start: CO2 is preferred as a solvent for several reasons:
whyCO2Points: A natural gas present in the atmosphere
Reaches the critical state at a relatively low temperature (Tc=31.2°C) and pressure (Pc=73.8 bar)

workingPrinciple.title: What Is the Working Principle of CO2 Extraction?
workingPrinciple.content: The fundamental principle of extraction is that CO2 dissolves molecules onto itself and leaves them in the separator through phase change or pressure drop. The gas and extract mixture is transported from the extractor to separator columns via a Back Pressure Regulator (BPR). The extract collects at the bottom of the separator column through pressure reduction, while the gas, after leaving the extract, is liquefied and fed back into the system.

steam.title: STEAM GENERATOR DISTILLATION SYSTEM
steam.content: Steam distillation is a method using a steam system to process plant products with high-pressure steam to obtain essential oils. In this method, plant materials are placed in a boiler. Steam is generated by boiling water in another boiler located underneath. This steam is sent to the boiler containing the plant materials. The steam breaks the cell walls of the plant materials, causing the essential oil to separate. The separated mixture of essential oil and water is condensed into liquid form using a condenser. The liquid mixture is separated into essential oil and water via a separator, thereby obtaining essential oil. Steam distillation using a steam system is the most common and effective method for obtaining essential oils from plant materials. The essential oils obtained through this method retain the natural properties of the plants and are of high quality. Through steam distillation, we obtain essential oils from 45 different plants such as rose, lavender, thyme, mint, sage, rosemary, and immortelle. Essential oils are used in many industries such as cosmetics, perfume, food, and pharmaceuticals. The steam generated in our steam distillation unit is entirely provided by a steam generator and does not contain carbon gases that are harmful to nature, as solid fuels do. The steam is produced using electricity. Our facility includes a steam generator distillation system with a capacity of 4,000 liters.

solid.title: SOLID FUEL DISTILLATION SYSTEM
solid.content: Our facility includes a solid fuel distillation system with a capacity of 1,300 liters.
steps: The material to be distilled is cleaned and placed into the boiler.
Water is filled into the bottom of the boiler and heated.
Solid fuel (wood, coal, pellets, etc.) is placed under the boiler and ignited.
As the water boils, steam is produced and transported through pipes to the boiler for steam distillation.
The steam vaporizes the essential oils or other components within the material and transports them through pipes to another boiler.
In this boiler, the steam is cooled and condensed into liquid form.
The essential oils or other components floating on the liquid are collected.
The water remaining underneath is recovered.

ingredients.description: Before using any essential oil, you should perform a patch test and immediately discontinue use in case of an adverse reaction. A patch test is a type of test used to determine an individual's skin sensitivity. We recommend performing a patch test on a 1-2 cm² area on the inner elbow or wrist before general use of the oil.
